column4: whenI run winetools... I get to the point where it's creating the fake_windows, and then proceeds to: "Invoking /usr/bin/wine rundll32.exe setupapi.dll,InstallHinfSection DefaultInstall 128 wine.inf ..." repeatedly, in an infinate loop
are you using wine from universe or from winehq.com?
universe
winetools works with wine from winehq.com, but not the version in universe
should I uninstall the one from universe and install the one in winehq?
if you want to use winetools, hyes.
sudo aptitude install wine=0.0.20050310-1
did you do what I showed you?
yes... and now winetools complains about files not existing, etc...
you removed wine from universe (sudo aptitude purge wine), and then "sudo aptitude install wine=0.0.20050310-1"?
I didn't see you say anything about purgeing... :P
well, at least remove it
ok, purged wine, then installed wine per the command you provided... anything special I should use to install winetools?
or just "sudo apt-get install winetools"?
sure, apt-get will work (I prefer aptitude)
and, is there anything I need to run before winetools, once its installed?
nope, just winetools, and step through the base setup, etc. in order.
do I need to run winetools as sudo? it's now complaining about permissions...
no...
I don't know.  Not sure what could be causing that.
it's ok... I'm a pro at the linux install/mess-up/reinstall cycle :P
